snippet.textDisplay:
Hearing the OST for the first time reminded of a monologue from Shawshank Redemption. 

The monologue came from Morgan Freeman after Tim Robbin‚Äôs character barricaded himself in the wardens office and played Mozart over the prison wide intercom system. In that moment all the inmates stood still while their souls were touched by the beautiful music coming from the speakers. 

Morgan‚Äôs character went on to explain that he had no idea what the Italian opera singers were saying and he didn‚Äôt want to know since some things are better left unsaid. He imagined they were singing something so beautiful that it couldn‚Äôt be expressed in words. It gave all of the inmates inexplainable hope and a sense of freedom for the briefest of moments.

I‚Äôm not serving a life sentence at a prison in Maine but I had and continue to have this experience when listening to this OST. I sit or walk in silence and feel unshackled from reality for the duration of the track before returning to day to day life. 

I don‚Äôt believe we have to be in dire circumstances to yearn for a hopeful future that eases the collective suffering that we face as a species and that of the defenseless animal kingdom. In fact, I find it disturbing when others find complacency while others around them are struggling or even worse blame the most powerless individuals in society for our shortcomings. 

With that being said, I don‚Äôt understand a word Alice Duport-Percier is saying while I listen to the OST and I don‚Äôt want to know. Some things are better left unsaid.
snippet.textOriginal:
Hearing the OST for the first time reminded of a monologue from Shawshank Redemption. 

The monologue came from Morgan Freeman after Tim Robbin‚Äôs character barricaded himself in the wardens office and played Mozart over the prison wide intercom system. In that moment all the inmates stood still while their souls were touched by the beautiful music coming from the speakers. 

Morgan‚Äôs character went on to explain that he had no idea what the Italian opera singers were saying and he didn‚Äôt want to know since some things are better left unsaid. He imagined they were singing something so beautiful that it couldn‚Äôt be expressed in words. It gave all of the inmates inexplainable hope and a sense of freedom for the briefest of moments.

I‚Äôm not serving a life sentence at a prison in Maine but I had and continue to have this experience when listening to this OST. I sit or walk in silence and feel unshackled from reality for the duration of the track before returning to day to day life. 

I don‚Äôt believe we have to be in dire circumstances to yearn for a hopeful future that eases the collective suffering that we face as a species and that of the defenseless animal kingdom. In fact, I find it disturbing when others find complacency while others around them are struggling or even worse blame the most powerless individuals in society for our shortcomings. 

With that being said, I don‚Äôt understand a word Alice Duport-Percier is saying while I listen to the OST and I don‚Äôt want to know. Some things are better left unsaid.

snippet.textDisplay:
Sandfall interactive from the bottom of my heart i thank you, you dont understand how much this game and this ost mean to me, it has helped me through a lot that has been happening over the course of this year. you have rekindled a flame that i had thought to have faded long ago. i was once a musician who had lost his path but "For those who come after" i shall do what needs to be done to contribute for when i am gone i shall leave them something to remember "because when one falls, we continue"
Thank you sandfall. thank you Lorien Testard ft. Alice Duport-Percier and the orchestra Orchestre Curieux thansk all the actors everyone. Thank you for this amazing experience of entertainment you have blessed this Earth within hope it can bring a form of piece along with it with its amazing story telling gameplay and overall direction. sincerely

snippet.textDisplay:
Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 and Final Fantasy X mirror each other in many ways. In both, the world is protected by a group on a tragic pilgrimage: summoners with their guardians in FFX, and the expeditioners in Expedition 33‚Äîwho are also acting as guardians themselves. Their goal is the same: to save the world, save the people, knowing it will cost lives. In FFX, the group kills Sin to bring a few years of Calm. In Expedition 33, they try to stop the Paintress and her Monolith to halt the Gommage‚Äîan effort that almost always fails.

Character parallels are also strong. Monoco in Clair Obscur looks like Kimahri‚Äî Lune is stoic, loyal, protective just like him. The living puppet that joins the party is like FFX‚Äôs airship. Both games also wrestle with the idea of a shortened lifespan. An early FFX concept had people living only to 17; this evolved into Yuna‚Äôs expected death during her pilgrimage. Expedition 33‚Äôs characters can only live till 33.which at the start of the game is still 34 (17 √ó 2 = 34).

At their core, both stories are about characters knowingly walking toward death, hoping their sacrifice buys a little more time for the world‚Äîor for the people they love. Eventually, it‚Äôs revealed that the fight was never just about saving the world. It was about clinging to the ones they lost, trying to hold on a little longer‚Äîlike the Farplane in FFX, or Yuna chasing Tidus's spirit in FFX-2.

Expedition 33‚Äôs characters can only live till 33.which at the start of the game is still 34 (17 √ó 2 = 34).

snippet.textDisplay: When I saw the videos on Steam for this game. What first caught my attention was the MUSIC. The story was so beyond typical a huge change from the norm. But what was echoing to me was how the first thing that came to my mind was my early days trying to play FF7 and FF11 as a young boy. It was beyond complicated for my age back then. I never completed them. But I knew just how DEEP and impactful some of the moments were. So I just HAD to try this... I was immediately taken back into the world I never thought I would see again. Roaming the lands... deep character stories... amazing combat... amazing visuals... I found myself in so many emotions through my playthrough. BRAVO!!!!
snippet.textOriginal: When I saw the videos on Steam for this game. What first caught my attention was the MUSIC. The story was so beyond typical a huge change from the norm. But what was echoing to me was how the first thing that came to my mind was my early days trying to play FF7 and FF11 as a young boy. It was beyond complicated for my age back then. I never completed them. But I knew just how DEEP and impactful some of the moments were. So I just HAD to try this... I was immediately taken back into the world I never thought I would see again. Roaming the lands... deep character stories... amazing combat... amazing visuals... I found myself in so many emotions through my playthrough. BRAVO!!!!

snippet.textDisplay: I love this game so much but I still haven't finished it. The only game where I don't feel frustrated even if I die 30 times against sprong. The satisfaction when I finally faced against golgra in dark gestral arena. the game is more fun when beating a mob while underleveled. I mostly parry 95% of the time. The 5% is when i play safe against attacks that applies debuff. Not sure if there had already been other turn based that uses same counter mechanic but the gameplay really sold me. On top of that, the characters are profound even though the story and history only started making sense after we beat the paintress. I already feel satisfied with my time in this game and I think I'm close to it's ending but I'm just enjoying fighting mobs I couldn't beat üòÇ

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm a completionist, I have a uncanny urge to do literally everyhing in a game I play, and I can admit that sometimes it can feel like a chore, but this time it's different. Exploring the
Continent and doing literally everything does not feel like a chore this time, in fact I look forward to it. Between the great gameplay, phenomenal lore and magical soundtrack, I don't need that urge to complete everything for this game, because everything about it already captivated me.

Trust me when I say it's hard to make a completionist to feel this way, and thank you for creating the experience.
snippet.textOriginal:

Trust me when I say it's hard to make a completionist to feel this way, and thank you for creating the experience.

snippet.textDisplay: At a time when the gaming scene was filled with remasters, remakes and generic AAA slop, a small French team brings to the world a labour of love, paying homage to the legendary titles that have come before while creating something completely unique. snippet.textDisplay:
Don't know how else to say this, but I am just so thankful that this game exists. 

In a gaming climate that has been taken over by corporate interest and profit-driven motives, to experience a game that just bleeds with passion from the developers is inspiring and powerful. Thank you Sandfall Interactive. Wish the gaming industry will be moved by this game in a way that it has moved me on such a deep level.

snippet.textDisplay:
This game (and the soundtrack) is living rent free in my mind right now...I am unable to stop thinking about it.  I'm self employed and work crazy long hours so I don't have the liberty of playing this as much as I want to but every free minute I have, I pick it up. I listen to the soundtrack on my daily commute and when I work in the evenings, I'm also watching some Expedition 33 related video.  I just can't get enough.  

Thank you, Sandfall.   This truly is a masterclass on everything I have ever wanted in a game.

snippet.textDisplay: I never liked French songs or classical music ‚Äî they always felt distant and not for me. But after playing Clair Obscur, everything changed. The way the developers wove music into the world, into the atmosphere, into the emotion of the game‚Ä¶ it completely caught me off guard. For the first time, I felt connected to a style I used to avoid. It wasn‚Äôt just music ‚Äî it was a feeling, a narrative, a part of something bigger. Huge respect to the devs ‚Äî you made me hear with different ears

snippet.textDisplay:
In 2015, we had The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.
In 2025, we have Clair Obscur: Expedition 33.

The music gives you chills ‚Äî every detail in the game fits perfectly with the soundtrack. It took ten years to feel something like this again. When a game and its music are made wholeheartedly, and the developers set aside their personal egos, it reminds us that games are created for the players, not just for the company.

snippet.textDisplay: I don't normally write reviews, but this gem of a game is something I never expected. I am an old man; I still remember the first Diablo, the first Quake, and even Return to Krondor. This game has reawakened my love for games. The cherry on top is the music. I don't understand anything, but it is so beautiful. My simple English can describe what I feel. I wanted to thank you guys for the experience.

snippet.textDisplay: Oh, team Sandfall, thank you so much. I'm 49 years old and have played games throughout most of my life. Of course, my view of gaming has evolved over time, but I have always seen it as a more evolved form of entertainment. I hope that what you created causes a paradigm shift in the quality with which video games are made. My top favorite games (chronologically): Pac-Man, Super Mario Bros., Zelda: Ocarina of Time, Star Wars: Knight of the Old Republic, Mass Effect 2, and now Clair Obscur: Expedition 33. I'm sure there are some other great games, but that's my personal list. This game is very consequential in my personal life because it's making me confront a grieving that I had buried & avoided years ago. I'm very thankful to all of you involved in creating this game- no, masterpiece.
snippet.textOriginal: Oh, team Sandfall, thank you so much. I'm 49 years old and have played games throughout most of my life. Of course, my view of gaming has evolved over time, but I have always seen it as a more evolved form of entertainment. I hope that what you created causes a paradigm shift in the quality with which video games are made. My top favorite games (chronologically): Pac-Man, Super Mario Bros., Zelda: Ocarina of Time, Star Wars: Knight of the Old Republic, Mass Effect 2, and now Clair Obscur: Expedition 33. I'm sure there are some other great games, but that's my personal list. This game is very consequential in my personal life because it's making me confront a grieving that I had buried & avoided years ago. I'm very thankful to all of you involved in creating this game- no, masterpiece.

snippet.textDisplay:
SandFall interactive.... Thank you so much to everyone in the studio for delivering this masterpiece of a game to the world! I've honestly lost the love for gaming because it seems like the passion has been lost and forgotten but this is such a breathtaking experience. Right from the beginning of the game, everything hits all the gamer cords in me... So much so that I lost myself in the beginning and cried. So again thank you from all the gamers in the world for the passion and love you have showed! I will be looking forward to you're next work!

For Those Who Come After, We continue ‚ù§Ô∏è

Every now and then, a game comes along that breathes new life into me and rekindles my passion for gaming ‚Äî especially RPGs like dragon quest XI ,Persona 5 and Metaphore. Some people say that turn-based RPGs are a thing of the past, but this game proves them wrong and redefines what the genre can be. I don‚Äôt think any game has done that better than this one.
and for me this game is a lost Final fantasy title as square forgot what final fantasy is all about .

As over 'Gommage' aged game player from South Korea, I prefer watch streamer playing the game rather than playing by myself but...
I had to actually play this game by myself...
Really like game style(Elden Ring + Baldur's Gate?) but also Mise-en-Sc√®ne, emotional part of the game including these beautiful OSTs and French style joke, talk, etc....

Gamer's world is quite filled with American joke and Japanese Otaku culture these days, but this game reminds me about the power of French culture

snippet.textDisplay: The moment I started Clair Obscur, I knew I have something special before me. It's not just a very well made game with really good gameplay. It's an experience. Something I missed for a long time in gaming. It's not my favourite game, far from it. But it's definitely my favourite video game experience of all time. And I have the weird feeling that this means more to me than favourite game.
snippet.textOriginal: The moment I started Clair Obscur, I knew I have something special before me. It's not just a very well made game with really good gameplay. It's an experience. Something I missed for a long time in gaming. It's not my favourite game, far from it. But it's definitely my favourite video game experience of all time. And I have the weird feeling that this means more to me than favourite game.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm Korean, and I usually only listen to English pop songs. But when I heard this song, I started to feel just how beautiful the French language is. It almost felt like I was listening to Elvish ‚Äî it has that mystical, fantasy-like vibe. It made me think that French really fits that kind of atmosphere. Honestly, it made me seriously consider learning French.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm an old gamer, I started playing NES in 1987 so yeah... Anyways, my all time favorites were Zelda, Diablo2, FF7, and GW1. Now this game has topped them all. I am an extremely picky gamer (I've not found a game I liked since GW1), and this game comes along... I knew when I saw the trailer over a year ago that I really wanted to play this game, and it has delivered. This game is not Game of the Year. It is Game of the Century for me.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm an old gamer, I started playing NES in 1987 so yeah... Anyways, my all time favorites were Zelda, Diablo2, FF7, and GW1. Now this game has topped them all. snippet.textDisplay:
Just finished Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 after 86 hours. 91% achievements. Zero regrets.
This game completely took me by surprise. Imagine if Legend of Dragoon, FF8, and Dark Souls had a baby and raised it in an art museum with a live orchestra. 
Combat is fast and vicious. Strategy matters. Timing matters. Screw up once and it‚Äôll humble you‚Äîhard. But when you get it right it feels so damn good.
The story though‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs wild. Deep, emotional, philosophical. Sometimes weird. Sometimes sad. Always beautiful. It didn‚Äôt just keep me invested it lingered.
Oh, and the soundtrack? Absolutely unreal. Every moment feels bigger because of that music. One second it‚Äôs soft and haunting, the next it‚Äôs blowing the doors off the emotional vault. Easily one of the best soundtracks I‚Äôve heard in years.
I didn‚Äôt expect this game to hit me like this. It‚Äôs honestly one of the most unique, emotional RPGs I‚Äôve ever played.
snippet.textOriginal:

Combat is fast and vicious. Strategy matters. Timing matters. Screw up once and it‚Äôll humble you‚Äîhard. But when you get it right it feels so damn good.
The story though‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs wild. Deep, emotional, philosophical. Sometimes weird. Sometimes sad. Always beautiful. It didn‚Äôt just keep me invested it lingered.
Oh, and the soundtrack? Absolutely unreal. Every moment feels bigger because of that music. One second it‚Äôs soft and haunting, the next it‚Äôs blowing the doors off the emotional vault. Easily one of the best soundtracks I‚Äôve heard in years.
I didn‚Äôt expect this game to hit me like this. It‚Äôs honestly one of the most unique, emotional RPGs I‚Äôve ever played.

I can't listen to this OST without a napkin.

snippet.textDisplay:
‚ÄãLast time I felt so connected to a game was back in 2000 (FF9). The personal attachments and emotional conflicts, partnered with this breath taking soundtrack, is just immaculate. Calling it a masterpiece almost feels like an understatement.

Now that I have finished the game..I now have a monolith-sized hole in my heart.

Bravo @@sandfallgames . Bravo. 

Thank you Sandfall for this beautiful work of art and passion.

snippet.textDisplay: @Sandfall Interactive Thank you. You have reignited the spark in this somber and broken man, long lost in darkness, to finish his own writing. As compensation, little though it may be, I have gifted a deluxe copy of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 on Steam to everyone I personally know that couldn't afford their own copy, even if they had access to it on Game Pass. I feel your masterpiece should be played by as many it can reach, and you deserve to reap the benefits of your hard work. I have gifted twelve copies so far, and have no intention of stopping until I'm published. God Bless your team for this lighthouse to safely guide this sailor to fortuned shores.
snippet.textOriginal: @Sandfall Interactive Thank you. You have reignited the spark in this somber and broken man, long lost in darkness, to finish his own writing. As compensation, little though it may be, I have gifted a deluxe copy of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 on Steam to everyone I personally know that couldn't afford their own copy, even if they had access to it on Game Pass. I feel your masterpiece should be played by as many it can reach, and you deserve to reap the benefits of your hard work. I have gifted twelve copies so far, and have no intention of stopping until I'm published. God Bless your team for this lighthouse to safely guide this sailor to fortuned shores.

snippet.textDisplay:
Clair Obscur should win the following Game Awards :

Game of the Year (HAS to win)
Best Game Direction (HAS to win)
Best Narrative (HAS to win)
Best Art Direction (HAS to win)
Best Score/Music (HAS to win)
Best Audio design (strong contender)
Best Performance (strong contender)
Best Independent Game (HAS to win)
Best Action Game (does it count as an action game? If yes it should probably win)
Best Action/Adventure Game (definitely an adventure game, has to win)
Best Role Playing Game (Does it count as an RPG? If yes, has to win)
Best Debut Indie Game (Absolutely has to win)

I can see it winning at least 8-9 category, max 12. Any less than 8 would be outrageous.

Un grazie anche dall'Italia per aver donato all'intero mondo un CAPOLAVORO ASSOLUTO. Se non vince il goty rimarrei assolutamente meravigliato. Miglior trama degli ultimi anni e di un originalit√† assoluta. Colpi di scena uno dietro l'altro e la voglia intrigante che saliva sempre di pi√† dentro me per conoscere i segreti che c'erano dietro ad ogni singolo dialogo. Comparto grafico e SOPRATTUTTO comparto artistico e sonoro di un livello ECCELSO. I pi√π vivi e sentiti complimenti per aver mostrato al mondo videoludico che la mente umana avr√† sempre qualcosa di meraviglioso da donare e preservare nel tempo! Un ottima, davvero ottima mossa anche rilasciarlo nel gamepass... il miglior servizio esistente. Grazie SANDFALL INTERACTIVE!

Thanks also from Italy for having donated an absolute masterpiece to the whole world. If the Goty does not win, I would be absolutely amazed. Best plot of the last few years and of absolute originality. Twist one after the other and the intriguing desire that went up more and more to know the secrets that were behind every single dialogue. Graphic sector and above all artistic and sound sector of an excellent level. The most lively and heartfelt compliments for showing the videogame world that the human mind will always have something wonderful to donate and preserve over time! A great, really excellent move also to release it in the gamepass ... the best existing service. Thanks Sandfall Interactive!

snippet.textDisplay:
I think I myself am stuck in the painting world of this game. 2 days since I finished platinum and yet I continue playing without anything to do. Just roaming the continent, taking in the scenery and enjoying the music.

Maybe because the portrayal of grief hit too close to home, but damn you Sandfall for dropping a masterpiece that made me bawl my eyes out crying from the first 5 mins in game to the ending cinematic. I need to escape this painting myself.

snippet.textDisplay: As a sound engineer, I am almost positive that at least the first song in this video is NOT live audio of what we are seeing in the video and that the musicians are playing along/miming with the OST recording which is sync'd up later.  There are zero close mics visible in these shots (which is necessary for some of the pristine, intimate capture in some spots) and this audio is indistinguishable from what we hear in the in-game OST.  That being said, I don't really care because this is still fucking awesome and we need more exposure to dope classical music.  Plus I am aware that for making content, this sort of practice is almost a necessity in today's age, and it makes the musicians in the video no less brilliant.
snippet.textOriginal: As a sound engineer, I am almost positive that at least the first song in this video is NOT live audio of what we are seeing in the video and that the musicians are playing along/miming with the OST recording which is sync'd up later.  There are zero close mics visible in these shots (which is necessary for some of the pristine, intimate capture in some spots) and this audio is indistinguishable from what we hear in the in-game OST.  That being said, I don't really care because this is still fucking awesome and we need more exposure to dope classical music.  Plus I am aware that for making content, this sort of practice is almost a necessity in today's age, and it makes the musicians in the video no less brilliant.

snippet.textDisplay: It has been such a pleasure to play the game and hear your beautiful music each time. Thank you so much to all the musicians and engineers involved for your immaculate performances. Thank you Lorien and Alice for sharing your art and passion with us. Bravo!

snippet.textDisplay:
To the incredible team at Sandfall Studio,

I want to express my deepest gratitude for your breathtaking creation, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33. It was a truly magical experience in every sense of the word‚Äîits stunning world, unique style, and immersive atmosphere left a lasting impression on me.

This is more than just a game; it's an emotional and artistic journey that masterfully blends storytelling and visual brilliance. You don‚Äôt just develop games‚Äîyou craft living, breathing worlds that stay with us long after the screen fades to black.

Consider me from this moment on one of your biggest fans. I look forward with great anticipation to your future projects. Wishing you continued success, growth, and creativity.

With sincere appreciation.
snippet.textOriginal:
To the incredible team at Sandfall Studio,

I want to express my deepest gratitude for your breathtaking creation, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33. It was a truly magical experience in every sense of the word‚Äîits stunning world, unique style, and immersive atmosphere left a lasting impression on me.

This is more than just a game; it's an emotional and artistic journey that masterfully blends storytelling and visual brilliance. You don‚Äôt just develop games‚Äîyou craft living, breathing worlds that stay with us long after the screen fades to black.

Consider me from this moment on one of your biggest fans. I look forward with great anticipation to your future projects. Wishing you continued success, growth, and creativity.

With sincere appreciation.

snippet.textDisplay:
I hope you - the ones who created this masterpiece - read this comment.  

This is one of the very few creations (I can‚Äôt even bring myself to call it just a "game") in all the time I‚Äôve spent in the virtual world - and I‚Äôve existed in it for most of my life - that I would gladly go to a theater to hear its music performed live. Your work has rekindled my love for games, which I had long lost due to the endless flood of soulless, hollow shells we‚Äôre forced to endure every year. After a full decade of waiting for a game that would make me simply want to exist in its world, I‚Äôm overjoyed to have finally found it.  

From the bottom of my heart, thank you for this masterpiece and for the passion and emotion you poured into this story. I hope in the coming years to see a new creation from you - one with an open world where I can explore, listen to your music, and lose myself in its characters and beautiful setting. A world where I can just be, like in one of my all-time favorites "The Witcher 3".  

I hate when stories end. I would have loved to keep exploring the world of Expedition 33 if it had been open-world. But I hope your team feels inspired to undertake such an ambitious project next, especially with the millions of people ready to support you in your future endeavors! Thank you again, from the depths of my heart!

snippet.textDisplay:
I know we are all gamers, but this Soundtrack is BEYOND gaming. This is an icon of European and French culture. While only Asian developers could do Wukong. Only Americans could deliver GTA, this is a true testament to the Old Continent and what Europe can bring to the World. 
Screw globalism, screw inclusion. True art comes from a place of integrity to one's culture and story. To me, this soundtrack is beyond just winning an award, this is a call to creativity and art for all of us regardless of where we come from. A Masterpiece.
snippet.textOriginal:
I know we are all gamers, but this Soundtrack is BEYOND gaming. This is an icon of European and French culture. While only Asian developers could do Wukong. Only Americans could deliver GTA, this is a true testament to the Old Continent and what Europe can bring to the World. 
Screw globalism, screw inclusion. True art comes from a place of integrity to one's culture and story. To me, this soundtrack is beyond just winning an award, this is a call to creativity and art for all of us regardless of where we come from. A Masterpiece.

snippet.textDisplay:
Not wanting to be lengthy but I can't do anything else. From the story to the setting to the world building and exploration, while not speaking about so many details that add up perfectly, you have all created a masterpiece. But, special credit has to go to the music. Nothing apart from some, very few, pieces of media have intrigued me so much from the start and the music in this game does so much more than that. Idk how many fight I've lost cause I was focusing on the music. I hadn't even finished the game and was waking up and reading books with what I had heard at the time. Thanks for releasing in Spotify as well. Honestly, words can't describe the music in this game. 
No matter what happens with awards and stuff, players know and you as a company should know how perfect this is, thank you for creating this, will certainly be looking forward to more and more.

Edit: not sure how these things work but I would pray you make any kind of Europe tour if that's possible, would definitely try to come and hear a performance live, surely an experience of a lifetime
snippet.textOriginal:
Not wanting to be lengthy but I can't do anything else. From the story to the setting to the world building and exploration, while not speaking about so many details that add up perfectly, you have all created a masterpiece. But, special credit has to go to the music. Nothing apart from some, very few, pieces of media have intrigued me so much from the start and the music in this game does so much more than that. Idk how many fight I've lost cause I was focusing on the music. I hadn't even finished the game and was waking up and reading books with what I had heard at the time. Thanks for releasing in Spotify as well. Honestly, words can't describe the music in this game. 
No matter what happens with awards and stuff, players know and you as a company should know how perfect this is, thank you for creating this, will certainly be looking forward to more and more.

Edit: not sure how these things work but I would pray you make any kind of Europe tour if that's possible, would definitely try to come and hear a performance live, surely an experience of a lifetime

snippet.textDisplay:
This game has reached my heart again since Final Fantasy 10, filled me with joy and love and still broke my heart in the end. This game is an absolute masterpiece. Unique and indescribably good. However, after finishing the game, I now feel an emptiness and sadness within me that I have never felt before. I laughed often but also cried many tears. I would like to thank everyone from the bottom of my heart who made this game a reality and made it possible. I hope for more of this. 

With love, Andi

snippet.textDisplay:
Completely speechless. This game should be this year's GOTY and win in several categories. The only scenario where that can't happen is if a game comes out between now and November that completely redefines gaming and changes the entire paradigm, something I obviously don't see possible.

I have earned all the achievements and look forward to DLC and more games from the company. I hope they can maintain this level and even improve it, it would not be strange to think that in case of maintaining it, they compete with the quality of companies like From Software.

PS: In my humble opinion, this game redefines what an RPG should be. Besides I really appreciate that you can feel the French spirit in the game at every moment. Greetings from Argentina
snippet.textOriginal:
Completely speechless. This game should be this year's GOTY and win in several categories. The only scenario where that can't happen is if a game comes out between now and November that completely redefines gaming and changes the entire paradigm, something I obviously don't see possible.

I have earned all the achievements and look forward to DLC and more games from the company. I hope they can maintain this level and even improve it, it would not be strange to think that in case of maintaining it, they compete with the quality of companies like From Software.

PS: In my humble opinion, this game redefines what an RPG should be. Besides I really appreciate that you can feel the French spirit in the game at every moment. Greetings from Argentina

snippet.textDisplay: Amazing to see Alice aka Lilou here! Alice used to be part of the Grissini Project for so many years. It almost feels like this is a video of theirs. I also thought one of the cellists was one of their former members.. The conductor who did the orchestration of the OST is from Orchestre Curieux who also performed with Grissini Project and Lilou live a while back.. EDIT: actually the conductor himself was part of Grissini Project as an editor director of their videos.. no wonder this video looks like one of the Grissini's ...wow it's really a spin off of the Grissini Project. It is great they found Lorien as a composer but I can only feel sad for Romain Vaude..
snippet.textOriginal: Amazing to see Alice aka Lilou here! Alice used to be part of the Grissini Project for so many years. It almost feels like this is a video of theirs. I also thought one of the cellists was one of their former members.. The conductor who did the orchestration of the OST is from Orchestre Curieux who also performed with Grissini Project and Lilou live a while back.. EDIT: actually the conductor himself was part of Grissini Project as an editor director of their videos.. no wonder this video looks like one of the Grissini's ...wow it's really a spin off of the Grissini Project. It is great they found Lorien as a composer but I can only feel sad for Romain Vaude..

snippet.textDisplay: The title "Clair Obscur" in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is the French translation of the Italian phrase chiaroscuro, which refers to a visual art method that highlights the sharp contrast between light and dark to produce depth and drama. This idea is fundamental to the game's aesthetic and thematic design, which reflects its examination of duality like hope and despair, life and death, and light and darkness.
snippet.textOriginal: The title "Clair Obscur" in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is the French translation of the Italian phrase chiaroscuro, which refers to a visual art method that highlights the sharp contrast between light and dark to produce depth and drama. This idea is fundamental to the game's aesthetic and thematic design, which reflects its examination of duality like hope and despair, life and death, and light and darkness.

snippet.textDisplay:
Since the first appearing, I was caught by the visuals and soundtracks, I started aprecciating it since then. Played the game for some few hours days ago, felt that emotional charge of the Gommage part (Gustave and Sophie), and then, you bring this to us.
I wish to every of you involved in this project (from dev team to orchestra, mainly the orchestra, cause you know... I'm a cellist üòÖ) all the best and due recognition you guys deserve.
There is no price that pays the immersion and magic this masterpiece has offered to us.
Thank you guys for all the love and efforts. ‚ô•
Kudos to every of you!
snippet.textOriginal:
Since the first appearing, I was caught by the visuals and soundtracks, I started aprecciating it since then. Played the game for some few hours days ago, felt that emotional charge of the Gommage part (Gustave and Sophie), and then, you bring this to us.
I wish to every of you involved in this project (from dev team to orchestra, mainly the orchestra, cause you know... I'm a cellist üòÖ) all the best and due recognition you guys deserve.
There is no price that pays the immersion and magic this masterpiece has offered to us.
Thank you guys for all the love and efforts. ‚ô•
Kudos to every of you!

snippet.textDisplay:
I haven't stopped in the menu for a long time to listen to the musical theme to the end.
Every frame is a work of art.
(The plot and script - if you allow a comparison with good Japanese animation, for example Hayao Miyazaki). 
If this is not the game of the year, if this is not the design of the year and not the musical accompaniment of the year... 
it is definitely a work of art.
Proof that games are a real form of art.

THANK YOU Sandfall Interactive.
This game can really save your life.

snippet.textDisplay:
Dear Lorien-Alice-Musicians-Sandfall team, 
It is unmeasurable to quantify how much effort, sacrifice, passion, and love you all poured into this proyect, but we sure can FEEL IT!
Your music has helped me cope with the gommage of my pet. "When she fell, life continues"... Having experienced this game/art/music through this process warms my soul and changed my life. Merci to all of you! You have created a remarkable masterpice.
I wish yall every award there is... The industry will change thanks to you!
Tomorrow comes....

snippet.textDisplay:
Je n'ai pas les mots pour dire √† quel point l'OST de Clair Obscur : Exp√©dition 33 est juste sublime. C'est un pur voyage musical, sensoriel et emotionnel, un jeu avec une telle OST est tr√®s rare, je ne vois pas comment le jeu ne peut pas au moins remporter l'Awards de la meilleure soundtrack aux prochain G.A.
Un immense bravo √† toute l'√©quipe orchestrale et √† toute l'√©quipe de Sandfall Interactive pour ce jeu fabuleux !

I don't have the words to say just how sublime the OST for Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is. It's a pure musical, sensory and emotional voyage, and a game with an OST like this is very rare. I don't see how the game can't at least win the award for best soundtrack at the next G.A.
A huge well done to the entire orchestral team and the entire Sandfall Interactive team for this fabulous game!
